translations: n．悬崖，峭壁：陡峭的山崖或岩石，通常高度很高，边缘险峻。
· The mountain climbers carefully navigated the steep precipices.
登山者们小心翼翼地穿越陡峭的悬崖。

sentences.sentence: With fantastic views, precipices and waterfalls, the valley is absolutely fascinating.
sentences.translation: 这里有美到极致的风景，巍峨的悬崖峭壁，壮观的瀑布。

sentences.sentence: Crashing waves from the Baltic Sea sculpted the 400-foot (120-meter) precipices of the island's eastern shore.
sentences.translation: 来自波罗的海猛冲猛撞的海波浪把该岛东部海岸雕刻成400英尺(120米)高的悬崖。

sentences.sentence: We all know how well owls see at night. Hills, hillocks, precipices-all these our owl distinguished as if it had been daylight.
sentences.translation: 众所周知，猫头鹰在夜间视力很好，斜坡啦、山丘啦、悬崖啦——它都能辨认出来，就像在白天一样。
